title: III Points Festival Returning to Miami in 2025 With Diverse and Daring Lineup
description: In a world of copy-paste music festival posters, III Points has once again hit Command-Z with an impressive multi-genre lineup led by Michael Bibi, Peggy Gou and other electronic innovators.
author: Jason Heffler
excerpt: In a world of copy-paste music festival posters, III Points has once again hit Command-Z with an impressive multi-genre lineup led by Michael Bibi, Peggy Gou and other electronic innovators.
siteName: EDM.com - The Latest Electronic Dance Music News, Reviews & Artists
text: In a world of copy-paste music festival posters, III Points has once again hit Command-Z with an impressive multi-genre lineup led by Michael Bibi, Peggy Gou and other electronic innovators.In a world of copy-paste music festival posters, III Points has once again hit Command-Z with an impressive multi-genre lineup led by Michael Bibi, Peggy Gou and other electronic innovators.HomeEVENTSMiami's homegrown music disruptor is back, and they're not pulling any punches.The organizers of III Points have unveiled the festival's 2025 lineup ahead of its return to its longtime home at Mana Wynwood from October 17–18. The 11th edition is stacked with artists that span the genre spectrum, from acid-fueled techno and nu-disco to leftfield hip-hop.III Points 2025 will feature performances by Black Coffee, Sub Focus, Chase & Status, Peggy Gou, Michael Bibi, Adam Ten, Nico Moreno, Nina Kraviz, Barry Can't Swim, ANOTR and EDM.com Class of 2023 inductee Indira Paganotto, among other electronic music stars. The lineup is rounded out by a compelling list of multi-genre stars like Phantogram, Denzel Curry, Sean Paul, Magdalena Bay, Thundercat and more."It is not easy navigating a forward-thinking, multi-genre festival in the North American music landscape nowadays, but I believe our commitment to our Miami music community has been the guiding force for us," said III Points co-founder David Sinopoli.Scroll to ContinueRecommended ArticlesThat sense of local devotion and cultural pride has long defined III Points. Since 2013, the festival has served as both a launchpad for emerging underground artists and a laboratory for experimental vanguards. This year's billing keeps that spirit alive, and if past is prologue, we can expect even deeper layers of weirdness and wonder in the lineup's next phases.Beyond the music, III Points remains one of North America's most thoughtfully curated music fests. Its location in the Wynwood Arts District, a technicolor playground of street art and post-industrial vibes, sets the tone for a surrealist festival experience.Check out the full lineup below. html:
In a world of copy-paste music festival posters, III Points has once again hit Command-Z with an impressive multi-genre lineup led by Michael Bibi, Peggy Gou and other electronic innovators.

In a world of copy-paste music festival posters, III Points has once again hit Command-Z with an impressive multi-genre lineup led by Michael Bibi, Peggy Gou and other electronic innovators.

  • Home
  • EVENTS

Miami's homegrown music disruptor is back, and they're not pulling any punches.

The organizers of III Points have unveiled the festival's 2025 lineup ahead of its return to its longtime home at Mana Wynwood from October 17–18. The 11th edition is stacked with artists that span the genre spectrum, from acid-fueled techno and nu-disco to leftfield hip-hop.

III Points 2025 will feature performances by Black Coffee, Sub Focus, Chase & Status, Peggy Gou, Michael Bibi, Adam Ten, Nico Moreno, Nina Kraviz, Barry Can't Swim, ANOTR and EDM.com Class of 2023 inductee Indira Paganotto, among other electronic music stars. The lineup is rounded out by a compelling list of multi-genre stars like Phantogram, Denzel Curry, Sean Paul, Magdalena Bay, Thundercat and more.

"It is not easy navigating a forward-thinking, multi-genre festival in the North American music landscape nowadays, but I believe our commitment to our Miami music community has been the guiding force for us," said III Points co-founder David Sinopoli.

Scroll to Continue

Recommended Articles

That sense of local devotion and cultural pride has long defined III Points. Since 2013, the festival has served as both a launchpad for emerging underground artists and a laboratory for experimental vanguards. This year's billing keeps that spirit alive, and if past is prologue, we can expect even deeper layers of weirdness and wonder in the lineup's next phases.

Beyond the music, III Points remains one of North America's most thoughtfully curated music fests. Its location in the Wynwood Arts District, a technicolor playground of street art and post-industrial vibes, sets the tone for a surrealist festival experience.

Check out the full lineup below. Tickets for III Points can be purchased here.
